text:
- Hello, my name is Rachel
Fu and I'm a product manager

with the AWS Database
Migration Service Team.

And I'm here to talk to
you about Fleet Advisor.
So when we talk about DMS Fleet Advisor,
I think it helps to kind of look at it
in the context of the phases of migration.
So when we think about migrations,
the first phase is the assess phase,

where we are investigating
what should be migrated,
we're making a migration plan.
The second phase is mobilize

where we're kind of coming
up with a deeper plan,
investigating how we're going to execute.

And the third phase is
migrate and modernize phase
where we're actually migrating the data
or the servers or the applications.

So when we think about
migrations holistically,
we know we need to migrate servers,
applications, and storage.
And AWS has various tools
to help with those pieces of migration

including Migration
Evaluator and Migration Hub.

So AWS DMS Fleet Advisor
really kind of fits

into the assess phase
specifically for databases.

So it helps you automatically
inventory databases.
It has an agentless collector

that's going to discover
these inventories of databases

and it's going to give
you some information
about metadata that has been collected

and about the infrastructure
that is currently employed.

Okay, so now that we
know where Fleet Advisor
kind of fits into the ecosystem of tools,

let's talk a little
bit about how it works.

So I mentioned earlier
it has a local collector.
So we install this local collector
into an on-premises data center

and this helps us to gather
all of the information

about OS servers and
databases that are discovered.

And then we then upload all
that data to your S3 bucket

and from your S3 bucket,
it then is populated

into the DMS console where
you can audit the inventory

and you can do some analysis
to understand schema complexity
and duplicate schemas.
And then it's kind of a continual process

of gathering more
information about databases

that is then available to
audit in your DMS console.

So now that we've talked
about how it works,
let's look at some of the key features.

So really, Fleet Advisor is
for analyzing the key data
that's important for planning a migration.

Currently, it discovers and
analyzes Oracle, SQL Server,
MySQL, and PostgreSQL databases.

You can export the
findings or the inventory
from Fleet Advisor into a CSV file

that you can then share
with all stakeholders

involved in the migration
planning process.
And one of the key capabilities
is that this is actually free.
So this is a free feature of AWS DMS.

So there's no risk to
go in and give it a try.

And finally, Fleet
Advisor also supports LDAP
or Lightweight Directory Access Protocol
which can be used for network scanning.

So thank you for listening
to this presentation.

For more information, please
check out our AWS DMS website
which has information about Fleet Advisor.

Or feel free, again,
it's a free capability,
feel free to log into the AWS DMS console
and just give it a try.
Thank you.
(gentle music)
